/-- If `F.cones` is represented by `X`, the cone corresponding to a morphism `f : Y âŸ¶ X` is
the limit cone extended by `f`. -/
theorem cone_of_hom_fac {Y : C} (f : Â«expr âŸ¶ Â» Y X) : coneOfHom h f = (limitCone h).extend f :=
  by
  dsimp [cone_of_hom, limit_cone, cone.extend]
  congr with j
  have t := congr_fun (h.hom.naturality f.op) âŸ¨(Â«exprðŸ™Â») XâŸ©
  dsimp at t
  simp only [comp_id] at t
  rw [congr_fun (congr_arg nat_trans.app t) j]
  rfl
#align cone_of_hom_fac cone_of_hom_fac
cone_fac:
/-- If `F.cones` is represented by `X`, any cone is the extension of the limit cone by the
corresponding morphism. -/
theorem cone_fac (s : Cone F) : (limitCone h).extend (homOfCone h s) = s :=
  by
  rw [â† cone_of_hom_of_cone h s]
  conv_lhs => simp only [hom_of_cone_of_hom]
  apply (cone_of_hom_fac _ _).symm
#align cone_fac cone_fac
